definitions.definition: To roll or fold up; to wind round; to entwine.
To envelop completely; to surround; to cover; to hide.
definitions.example: to involve in darkness or obscurity

definitions.definition: To complicate or make intricate, as in grammatical structure.
To connect with something as a natural or logical consequence or effect; to include necessarily; to imply.
To take in; to gather in; to mingle confusedly; to blend or merge.
To engage (someone) to participate in a task.
definitions.example: By getting involved in her local community, Mary met lots of people and also helped make it a nicer place to live.

definitions.definition: To raise to any assigned power; to multiply, as a quantity, into itself a given number of times.
definitions.example: a quantity involved to the third or fourth power
He related an involved story about every ancestor since 1895.

definitions.definition: Associated with others, be a participant or make someone be a participant (in a crime, process, etc.)
definitions.example: He got involved in a bar fight.
